meanings.definition: A person or thing that creates furrows.
meanings.sent1: The farmer used the furrowers to make neat rows for planting seeds.
meanings.sent2: The furrowers in the field left behind straight lines where the plow had passed.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous rabbits were the furrowers in the garden, digging up the freshly planted vegetables.
meanings.sent4: The furrowers of time etch lines on our faces, marking the passage of years.
meanings.sent5: The furrowers carved deep grooves in the soft soil, shaping the landscape.

meanings.definition: Those who engage in the act of furrowing.
meanings.sent1: The dedicated furrowers worked tirelessly to prepare the land for the upcoming season.
meanings.sent2: The furrowers labored under the hot sun, sweat glistening on their brow.
meanings.sent3: The furrowers at the farm competition raced to see who could plow the straightest line.
meanings.sent4: The furrowers of the earth, they toiled day in and day out to ensure a bountiful harvest.
meanings.sent5: The furrowers moved in unison, their synchronized movements creating a mesmerizing pattern in the field.
